item.title: 3metre tree branch causing a hazard to the public footpath, 22nd February
item.description:
This very large and heavy branch has been a hazard to the footway for other a month. It requires moving as it is a hazard to pedestrians, especially young children due to the produding branches sticking out of it. Please can the branch be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lulworth Road, Mottingham, Greater London

item.title: Parked badly, 22nd February
item.description:
Car has been parked with back end out for a few days causing cars to veer into the middle of the road to go around it. I have been away and came back to find the car still there.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Thaxted Road, New Eltham

item.title: Community treats area as dumping ground, 22nd February
item.description:
Area being treated as a dumping ground again by community. Started as one bag of rubbish by close of play 21/02. This was dumped during the night of 21/02. All residents were sent flytipping leaflets from council. No excuse for it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Waltham Gardens, Enfield
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Plastic bin bag full of rubbish, 22nd February
item.description:
Someone has left a large plastic bin bag full of rubbish in between the telecommunication cabinets adjacent to the free parking area in Valentine Ave (opposite entrance to the allotments). The contents are now being spread around the place by foxes causing a mess on the footpath and is now a potential trip hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Valentine Avenue, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
